intro: Biscutella valentina var. divionensis, commonly known as the Divionensis biscutella, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy leaves, typical of the genus Biscutella. It thrives in calcareous soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
